data.description:
[DAOstar](https://daostar.org) is the standards body of the DAO ecosystem, composed of over 80 key organizations in the space including every major DAO framework, a large number of DAO tooling companies, and many major DAOs. We're the IETF of DAOs.

We authored and maintain [EIP-4824 / DAOIP-2: Common Interfaces for DAOs](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4824), along with [many other standards](https://github.com/metagov/daostar/tree/main/DAOIPs) already published and in development. You can participate in the [working groups](https://daostar.one/), or start contributing to our [discussion forum](https://github.com/metagov/daostar/discussions).

Help us shape the future of DAOs!
data.title: DAOstar
DAOstar
data.description: DAOstar is the standards body for DAOs. At present, the DAOstar One roundtable includes 90 [member organizations](https://daostar.one/) working on improving the state of DAO metadata, grants management, attestations, and regulatory interoperability. We are fiscally sponsored by [Metagov](https://www.linkedin.com/company/metagovernance-project/) and grant-funded by the Ethereum Foundation, Optimism Collective, Arbitrum Foundation, Gnosis, Aragon, Radicle, MolochDAO, MetaCartel Ventures, The Graph, and many other members of DAOstar One.

DAOIP-5 is a metadata schema developed by DAOstar to standardize the web3 grants ecosystem to improve transparency, interoperability, and a whole lot more.

# Motivation

As the Web3 space has grown in recent years, grant programs run by protocols and projects have themselves exploded in size and popularity. Over a billion dollars in capital have been deployed or committed, grant programs have come and gone, and many organizations are now assessing the progress and impact of their issued funding.

There have been a wide range of approaches, from transparent (e.g. Aave) or closed (e.g. Ethereum Foundation and Solana Foundation) to communally architected (e.g. Stacks Foundation) to being launched by a compensated team (e.g. Mantle), from prospective (e.g. Uniswap Foundation) to retroactive (e.g. Optimism) to research-focused (e.g. Protocol Labs Research Grants) to quadratically funded (e.g. Gitcoin), to RFP-based (i.e. Protocol Labs, Uniswap Foundation, Solana Foundation, etc.). The diversity of thought on how to best run such programs has led to innovative approaches for grants management but has also fragmented capital and reduced transparency.

This specification lays out a set of off-chain data schemas for grant programs looking to deploy funding and for projects looking to receive funding, as well as a simple attestations architecture. It is intended to increase interoperability between grants tooling, improve the transparency of grant programs, and ultimately make grant programs more efficient for funders, administrators, and grantees. In particular, this specification lays the groundwork for a “common application” for grants as well as easier coordination between grants programs.

# What Is The Full Daoip-5 Vision?

To be the Best Data Source For Grants
Common Application for Grantees
A Live Pipeline of Data from Grant Programs
Limit Grant Farming
Connect with DAOIP-5 OAuth across Grants Programs
Reputation Systems for Grantees and Grantors
Public Impact Verification
Enabling Higher Quality Impact Evaluation
Increased Interoperability between Grant Tooling 
Retroactive Funding on Impact
data.title: DAOIP-5 Grants Standard by DAOstar - Improving the web3 grants ecosystem for everyone
GG18 - Web3 OSS

questions.query: How does your project contribute significantly to the Ethereum network's infrastructure? Please provide specific examples and metrics if available.
questions.explanation: We authored EIP-4824 as well as many other DAOIPs, maintain Web3's largest grants data lake, and write research reports on the state of DAOs (e.g. recent one on DAO M&A).

questions.query: Describe any pioneering development work in your project, particularly in enhancing privacy, interoperability, or user experience.
questions.explanation: DAOIP-5 Grants Data Lake.

questions.query: What specific problems or challenges in the Ethereum ecosystem does your project address? How does your solution improve upon existing alternatives?
questions.explanation: How to make DAOs as powerful as traditional corporations. We build on existing DAO frameworks and tools.

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation: Grants will go toward engineers, designers, and researchers on DAOstar's team. See https://daostar.substack.com/p/daostar-year-in-review-2024 for our 2025 roadmap.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the decentralization and security of the Ethereum network?
questions.explanation: DAOstar contributes to more effective governance and decentralization within DAOs, many of whom (e.g. Lido) maintain the decentralization and security of Ethereum.

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

This project aims to innovate on the application of DAOs within the Optimism ecosystem. It involves the development of an attestation list schema specifically designed for DAOs, a web platform for displaying attestations made using this schema (hereby referred to as DAOIP-3) to any address, and the necessary infrastructure for deploying new instances of the platform.

Key components of the project include:

An attestation-based architecture and data model for DAO membership, member contributions, and other data: This standard will facilitate the onboarding of DAOs to Optimism and allow for DAO memberships to be contingent on parameters other than token ownership. This represents a novel approach to DAO membership and governance.

Web Platform for Attestations and Contributions: This platform will be capable of displaying DAOIP-3 attestations and contributions for any given Ethereum address. This will enhance transparency and accountability within DAOs.

Accompanying Infrastructure: This infrastructure will allow a client to deploy a new platform instance for a given Ethereum RPC-compatible network. This will increase the scalability and adaptability of the platform.
data.title: DAOstar: DAO Onboarding & Attestation List

data.description:
TO-DO (from grant application): 

An attestation-based architecture and data model for DAO membership, member contributions, and other data: This standard will facilitate the onboarding of DAOs to Optimism and allow for DAO memberships to be contingent on parameters other than token ownership. This represents a novel approach to DAO membership and governance.
data.title: Milestone 1

data.reason:
V0.2 of Attestation Standard for DAOs/ DAOIP-3: 
https://github.com/metagov/daostar/blob/main/DAOIPs/daoip-3.md

In this version, we:

1. interoperated with the W3C Verifiable Credential (VC) Specification to make the schema more widely applicable/analogous to verifiable credentials. 

2. added apiURI to support OpenAPI interoperability 

3. created a new generic Attestation type, added issuerURI and attestationURI to it 

4. added a new schema for attestation types (moved over from DAOstar's regulatory interoperability work) and attestationIssuersURI

5. added a new schema format for membership contributions

6. added an attestation type for publishing daoURI as an attestation

7. added a new rationale section

8. made other edits and updates as outlined here: https://github.com/metagov/daostar/pull/156

V0.2 of Attestation Standard for DAOs/ DAOIP-3: 
https://github.com/metagov/daostar/blob/main/DAOIPs/daoip-3.md

In this version, we:

1. interoperated with the W3C Verifiable Credential (VC) Specification to make the schema more widely applicable/analogous to verifiable credentials. 

2. added apiURI to support OpenAPI interoperability 

3. created a new generic Attestation type, added issuerURI and attestationURI to it 

4. added a new schema for attestation types (moved over from DAOstar's regulatory interoperability work) and attestationIssuersURI

5. added a new schema format for membership contributions

6. added an attestation type for publishing daoURI as an attestation

7. added a new rationale section

8. made other edits and updates as outlined here: https://github.com/metagov/daostar/pull/156

questions.explanation: https://github.com/metagov/daostar

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile to prior rounds.
questions.explanation: N/A

questions.query: How does your project contribute significantly to the Ethereum network's infrastructure? Please provide specific examples and metrics if available.
questions.explanation: We built and maintain EIP-4824 as well as a number of DAOIPs that serve as core data infrastructure for a range of DAOs and DAO tooling.

questions.query: Describe any pioneering development work in your project, particularly in enhancing privacy, interoperability, or user experience.
questions.explanation: EIP-4824 is explicitly focused on enhancing data interoperability between DAOs and DAO tools.

questions.query: What specific problems or challenges in the Ethereum ecosystem does your project address? How does your solution improve upon existing alternatives?
questions.explanation: DAOstar exists to support the longterm success of the DAO ecosystem through targeted investment in particular issues, from data interoperability to regulatory interoperability to security standards to specific DAO growth initiatives in regions like Asia and Southeast Asia.

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation: See https://github.com/metagov/daostar/milestones

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the decentralization and security of the Ethereum network?
questions.explanation: We support decentralization and security by supporting better DAOs, many of which then directly contribute to decentralization and security.

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

questions.query: Project GitHub Repo
questions.explanation: https://github.com/metagov/daostar

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round with this project? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile to prior rounds.
questions.explanation: Not this one specifically focused on DAOIP-5

questions.query: How does your project focus on building on, integrating with, or supporting the Allo Protocol ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of your work and plans.
questions.explanation:
We have been working closely with the Gitcoin team include Sov, Henry, and others on integrating DAOIP-5 into the new version of Allo. We have already integrated Gitcoin data into our MVP data lake held by OSO.

We are also partnered on providing two hackathon challenges for Funding the Commons st the moment. 

The standard was also co-authored with Gitcoin / Allo engineers.

questions.query: Describe your project's current status and roadmap. Are you actively developing on Allo Protocol, or do you have a clear plan for future integration?
questions.explanation: Our current status is that we are actively working on the lead up to Funding the Commons and Devcon in Bangkok to share with everyone  about the standard and how it will greatly improve the web3 grants ecosystem. We will be releasing more documentaiton for more grants programs to add data to the data lake and an SDK for developers to easily be able to integrate the DAOIP-5 API from OSO. This will connect several grants program data with Allo data.

questions.query: Outline your plans for community engagement and user adoption. How will you contribute to expanding the Allo ecosystem?
questions.explanation: We are alraedy partnering with Gitcoin on the Funding the Commons Hackathon around the standard and as well preparing talks and workshops for the time in Devcon. We will also be present at the Grants and Impact Hub in Devcon where we will be sharing more information. This will target grant program operators from other ecosystems to apply pressure for getting the standard adopted.

questions.query: How do you envision your project driving GMV (Gross Merchandise Value) through the Allo protocol? Please provide potential metrics or estimates.
questions.explanation: We believe that Gitcoin being one of the first adopters will push grant operators to flock to Allo because they know they will be able to better prove the success of their grant programs otherwise and lets them be compliant with DAOIP-5 while taking advantage of its benefits.

questions.query: Provide your Karma GAP profile link and briefly describe how you'll use it for milestone tracking.
questions.explanation:
https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/daostar/grants

We hope to use Karma GAP to show how we have progressed in adding new grants programs'  data, developed software libraries and expanded repos.

questions.query: If applicable, list any contract addresses or other verifiable on-chain objects related to your project that demonstrate your work with Allo. Use this format for each entry: [contract_address], [chain_id]
questions.explanation: NA
